A, LOCATION AND ADJACENT DEVELOPMENTS



Development Area 12 is located to the southeast of the intersection
of Baltimore Street and Hopkins Place, at the corner of a new Charles
Center superblock. i

A major asset of Area 12 is the public square to the south and east
of the site (see plan and photo on pages 25 and frontispiece). The plaza will
be builtover an 800-car self-service undergroundparking garage currently
under construction. Also under construction are the other buildings bor-
dering the public square: a 1500-1800 seat legitimate theatre with 39, 000
to 65,000 square feet of retail area and at least 150 public parking spaces;
a high-rise home office building for the Sun Life Insurance Company of
America; and a Federal Office Building containing approximately 460, 000
square feet of office space and an underground parking garage for 185 gov-
ernment vehicles.

Across Baltimore Street to the north will be a new Hilton Hotel and
to the northeast is the existing Lord Baltimore Hotel. Directly west, across
Hopkins Place, lies the Civic Center, which contains a 13, 000 seat colis-
eum, 100,000 square feet of exhibition space, meeting rooms and banquet
facilities. Both of these developments will be connected with Area 12 by
the Charles Center upper level walkway system.

B. A PLANNED DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT



Charles Center is planned with design and building controls in ac-
cordance with the most modern development practice. Each investor is
assured that subsequent developers will provide a suitable and harmonious
environment, consistent with the long range goals of Charles Center: the
best possible development of interrelated land uses, buildings and spaces,
working together to create the greatest possible return both to private de-
velopers and to the City, in terms of revenue, prestige, and design.

C. SITE DEFINITION



The property is '"L'" shaped, as shown on page 10. It contains
59,486.13 square feet, or 1.37 acres, more or less, with more than 500
feet of park frontage, the same amount of street frontage and more than 300
feet of second level walkway frontage. For the precise metes and bounds
description, see page I-2 of the Proposed Form of Disposition Agreement.
